content.user_title: Build MCP servers for LLM tool integration
content.value_statement: Creating effective MCP servers requires understanding protocol specifications, SDK patterns, and testing strategies. This skill provides comprehensive guides for building high-quality MCP servers in Python and TypeScript with evaluation frameworks to validate tool effectiveness.
actual_capabilities: Create MCP servers using Python FastMCP or TypeScript MCP SDK
Implement tools with proper input validation using Pydantic or Zod
Design response formats with JSON and Markdown support
Build evaluation tests to validate MCP server effectiveness
Configure transport layers (stdio, SSE, HTTP) for different deployment scenarios
limitations: Does not generate complete MCP server implementations automatically
Does not provide API authentication credentials or secrets
Does not execute MCP servers without explicit user configuration
Does not access external APIs directly for real data

prompt_templates.title: Python MCP Server
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a new Python MCP server
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a new MCP server using Python FastMCP for the GitHub API. Include Pydantic models for input validation and pagination support.

prompt_templates.title: TypeScript Tools
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a complete TypeScript example showing how to register MCP tools with Zod schemas, annotations, and structured content output.

prompt_templates.title: Evaluation Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an evaluation XML file with 10 challenging questions for a GitHub MCP server. Include guidelines for creating complex, read-only questions.

prompt_templates.title: Best Practices
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the recommended naming conventions, response formats, and security practices for MCP server development? Include tool annotations and error handling patterns.

output_examples.input: Create a Python MCP server for searching users with pagination
output: 1. Define Pydantic model with limit/offset parameters
2. Use httpx for async API requests
3. Return structured data with has_more and next_offset
4. Support both JSON and Markdown response formats
5. Add clear error messages for rate limits and auth failures

output_examples.input: Set up TypeScript MCP server project
output: 4. Register tools with inputSchema and descriptions
5. Run npm run build to verify compilation

best_practices: Use descriptive tool names with service prefixes to prevent conflicts across multiple MCP servers
Implement pagination with limit parameters and has_more indicators to prevent overwhelming responses
Include readOnlyHint, destructiveHint, idempotentHint, and openWorldHint annotations for each tool
anti_patterns: Avoid generic tool names like 'get_data' or 'search' that may conflict with other MCP servers
Do not return all results without pagination - this can exhaust context and cause timeouts
Avoid exposing raw API responses without formatting or filtering - structure data for LLM comprehension

faq.question: Which language should I use for MCP server development?
faq.answer: Both Python (FastMCP) and TypeScript (MCP SDK) are fully supported. TypeScript offers excellent SDK documentation and static typing benefits.

faq.question: How many tools should my MCP server implement?
faq.answer: Focus on the most valuable tools first. Quality matters more than quantity. Start with 3-5 core tools that enable complete workflows.

faq.question: How do I test if my MCP server works correctly?
faq.answer: Use the evaluation framework in this skill to create test questions. Run them against your server to verify LLMs can use your tools effectively.

faq.question: Is my API key secure when using MCP servers?
faq.answer: API keys should only be passed through environment variables. Never hardcode credentials. The evaluation script accepts keys via -e KEY=VALUE parameters.

faq.question: Why are my tool responses being truncated?
faq.answer: Response size limits protect context windows. Implement pagination with limit parameters. Add has_more indicators and next_offset values.

faq.question: How does MCP compare to direct API calls?
faq.answer: MCP provides structured tool definitions that help LLMs understand available operations. It handles authentication, input validation, and response formatting consistently.
